RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 76. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOOD ACCELEBRATE stumbled inward and into Imagine Rita leaving the gate then settled back from early contention while saving ground, started a long steady bid leaving the nine sixteenths pole and took the lead three wide past the five sixteenths, drew away on the far turn, was kept alert through the upper stretch then taken in hand later yards. SOMEBODY LOVES ME raced well off the pace, picked up the chase leaving the half mile pole, steadily improved in the four path on the far turn and came along for second mid-stretch. DASHING LASS ducked out and made contact with Imagine Rita leaving the gate then saved ground, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and dueled for third the final sixteenth. LINDA'S TAJ tapered in through the front stretch and rated the pace, came under pressure at the three eighths pole, was met leaving the five sixteenths, rounded the far turn near the rail and weakened in the lane. LADY CAIRO stalked through the front stretch but was forced wide into the first turn, corrected course and challenged from the three eighths pole but flattened off the rail on the far turn. IMAGINE RITA was squeezed at the break, raced in the three path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. ITSUPTOME drifted into the first turn and was through after a half mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Good Accelebrate
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled break,settled inside,long steady bid,up5/16,in hand late

ENTRY.NAME: Somebody Loves Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,off rail,chased 1/2,4p far turn,along 2nd 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 90. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 24000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-w inners Of A Race Since August 21 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 21 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OVERLY CRITICAL stalked from the three path on the first turn then gave chase into the backstretch, dueled at even terms from the five sixteenths pole, contested the far turn two deep, dug in determinedly to take over later yards and raced clear under the wire. STARBURST took over into the first turn and rated the pace, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, was met and dueled at even terms from the five sixteenths, contested the rail on the far turn and dug in gamely to late stretch before relenting. KENNY HAD A NOTION stalked off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail then flattened inside the eighth pole. CLASSY AMERICAN saved ground on the first turn then eased out and gave chase into the backstretch, rounded the far turn about the three path and weakened in the lane. MIND YOUR OWN raced with the early pace inside but dropped back leaving the nine sixteenths pole and faded past the three eighths.

ENTRY.NAME: Starburst
ENTRY.OWNER: Dare To Dream Stable LLC (Michael Faber)

ENTRY.NAME: Kenny Had a Notion
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 3/8,rail far turn,flattened lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: REMY'S HOTSHOT took the lead passing the half mile pole and rated the pace, came under pressure toward the five sixteenths pole, rounded the turn at the rail and was steadily handled to hold on. LONA LEE gave chase inside, raced at the rail on the turn, eased to the two path leaving the turn, but was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. MALIBU YEARS chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path, dug in leaving the turn and took over third later yards. PETTY PERFECT broke clear then gave chase leaving the half mile pole, raced off the rail on the turn and flattened the final sixteenth. ROMAN CANDLE chased through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. IMADHI gave chase while saving ground. QUINN ELIA became a bit anxious in the gate, gave chase through the backstretch and raced in the five path on the turn. SPECIAL KAYLEE gave chase then flattened on the turn. LEONESSA saved ground.

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Timothy C. Grams & Judith A. Grams

ENTRY.NAME: Malibu Years
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,4p turn,dug in lane,up 3rd later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 93. Allowance Purse 32300. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 21 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 21 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or L ess Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LATE IN THE GAME stalked the early pace from the two and three paths, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole and took the lead two deep at the quarter, dueled clear nearing the head of the lane and was kept alert in the drive. NOBALLSTWOSTRIKES took over and rated the pace inside, dug in to the challenge of Machen's Ridge leaving the half mile pole and cleared that one, but was met at the quarter pole, dropped back toward the eighth pole and settled for second. MARTIN MAN settled off the pace in the three path then eased out into the backstretch, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and dueled through the stretch for third. CANDY INVASION settled close off the rail, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. MACHEN'S RIDGE stalked two deep then challenged leaving the half mile pole, dropped back approaching the quarter and weakened at the rail on the far turn. INDIAN EMPIRE raced in the four path early on but was through after a half mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Martin Man
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 100. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. No n-winners Of A Race Since August 21 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 21 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NICO broke inward then gave chase, raced close in the four path on the turn, dug in for the nod inside the sixteenth pole and inched further ahead nearing the wire. PRIMAL DESTINY set a pressured pace while tapering inward, moved to the rail approaching the quarter pole, was met mid-stretch and reluctantly ceded later yards. STORM BOARDER (CHI) pressured the early pace but steadied off the heels of Nico leaving the five sixteenths pole, rounded the turn about the three path and dug in to take third the final strides. DANCE CODE was pinched back at the start then gave chase inside, rounded the turn near the rail, eased out into the lane and finished well to pass rivals. MR TINGLES pressured the pace inside then steadied off the inside flank of Nico approaching the quarter pole, rounded the turn near the rail and flattened later yards. INSIDE RISK chased outside, rounded the turn in the four and five paths and weakened in the lane. CARIBBEAN PLEASURE broke outward then gave chase, raced near the rail on the turn and weakened nearing mid-stretch. The Stewards reviewed then rejected a claim of foul against the rider of Primal Destiny for alleged interference approaching the quarter pole, lodged by the rider of Storm Boarder.

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Tingles
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace inside,steadied nearing 1/4,rail turn,flattened late

ENTRY.NAME: Nico
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in,chased,4p far turn,nod inside 1/16,inched ahead

ENTRY.NAME: Primal Destiny
ENTRY.OWNER: Fitzpatrick Francis G and Muldoon William
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail into turn,met 1/16,reluctantly ceded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 16600. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,25 0 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CASTLE LIGHTS took over on the chute and rated clear, came under pressure past the quarter pole, rounded the turn at the rail and was kept alert in the stretch. NAUGHTY NAN exchanged contact with Comida Comida leaving the gate then gave chase inside, raced at the rail on the turn and dug in the final furlong to take second late yards. JUBA'S HOUSE chased inside and raced close off the rail on the turn, but drifted into the lane and flattened stride later yards. COMIDA COMIDA exchanged contact with Naughty Nan leaving the gate then gave chase, rounded the turn in the four path, left the turn outside and showed little further. MY SISTER CLURRIE gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three path and weakened. REIGN ON AND ON was not a factor. DANCE LIGHTLY saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Juba's House
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,close off rail turn,drifted 1/8,flattened later yds

ENTRY.NAME: Naughty Nan
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,chased inside,rail turn,dug in lane,up 2nd late

ENTRY.NAME: Castle Lights
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated clear,pressured past 1/4,rail turn,kept sharp lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 94. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since Augu st 21 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 21 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LITTLE ROO ROO came out and made contact with Duncan Idaho leaving the gate then accelerated to the lead approaching the seven sixteenths pole and rated the pace, was urged a bit leaving the five sixteenths pole, rounded the turn at the rail and raced mostly of his own initiative in the lane. TAP SECRET chased inside, rounded the turn at the rail, cleared second toward mid-stretch and finished well. DUNCAN IDAHO was bumped leaving the gate then pressured the pace from the seven sixteenths pole, dropped back approaching the quarter, raced off the rail on the turn and flattened inside the eighth pole. HE IS BONAFIDE chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the five path, left the turn outside and passed a rival. LION OF THE SEA gave close early chase then flattened in the four path on the turn. DAN THE MAN CAN steadied at the start and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Dan the Man Can
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 12700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MARCH 21, 2023. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 21 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4, 000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SCOTTSDALE took the lead and moved to the inside entering the first turn, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and was kept alert in the stretch. MOON OVER MONTANA saved ground off the pace, bid approaching the seven sixteenths pole and raced close in the three path on the far turn, but couldn't gain in the stretch. CANTAKEITANYMORE settled off the rail, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and flattened in the lane. MAKE WAY saved ground racing well off the pace, gave chase leaving the half mile pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn. MR HOOVER stalked off the rail, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole then faded at the rail on the far turn. CARTE BLANCHE stalked from the two and three paths, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened past the three eighths. KING THEO was pulled up lame after three sixteenths and was vanned off.

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Hoover
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Truett Wilbur
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 3/8,faded rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Moon Over Montana
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 7/16,close 3p far turn,no gain lane

ENTRY.NAME: Scottsdale
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured near 1/4,rail turn,kept alert lane
